column4: Hi all.  I'm setting up a machine running 10.10, and I'd like to set up a communal scratch space where all the users can read and write all the files without having to change permissions everytime something is added.  I think I'm clear on how to do this from the command line manually, but am I reinventing the wheel?  Is there already a directory for this sort of thing by default?
Mr_Copro: I had in mind to make this a semi-permanent dropbox.  Isn't /tmp cleared out periodically?
no cause each user has it's own 'uname' settings which determine default permissions on files
you can force permissions from the higher directory iirc. Did this on a webserver once
